comments:
I'm using Eclipse 3.2rc1 on Windows XP, and RSE M1 candidate.
Create a Dstore connection to a remote Linux host.
Verify that remote files can be accessed.

Choose New > Proejct > General > Project
Disable "Use default Location"
Choose Filesystem "RSE"
Press Browse button
Choose "My Home" ... some directory ... OK
Press Next, OK

--> Get following NPE:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileStoreRoot.toLocalPath(FileStoreRoot.java:120)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileStoreRoot.<init>(FileStoreRoot.java:57)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.setLocation(FileSystemResourceManager.java:806)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.internalSetDescription(Project.java:663)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.create(Project.java:291)
at org.eclipse.ui.wizards.newresource.BasicNewProjectResourceWizard.createProject(BasicNewProjectResourceWizard.java:269)
at org.eclipse.ui.wizards.newresource.BasicNewProjectResourceWizard$1.execute(BasicNewProjectResourceWizard.java:202)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
I just tried this today with Eclipse 3.2 rc3 and it works for me.  Do you still see this problem?

Works for me too with RC4.
Looks like this was a Platform bug.

Let's verify it again with the milestone and then close it.
